page.title: 01Gazetteer _ Dunnington
page.content: Our area,east of{York,}in the county of North Yorkshire, is mainly flat, with good farming conditions. Dunnington, the main village, is five miles from York.{Murton}is a smaller village,and nearer York,just East of the York by-pass. The Anglo-Saxons first settled here on a ridge of debris left by an Ice Age glacier. Dunnington has doubled its size in the last fifteen years but has not yet become a suburb of York.People are attracted to Dunnington because it is fairly lively and no main roads run through it. Now it is a commuter village handily placed near York with the York-Bridlington Road on the North and the Hull Road a mile away to the south. Dunnington is in the fork of the two which separate where they pass over the York by-pass.
